item.title: IND vs AUS Boxing Day Test: Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas spar on opening morning at MCG - The Hindu
item.description:
Kohli and Konstas Spar on MCG's Opening Morning of the Boxing Day Test

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Australia's rivalry with India escalated this morning as Virat Kohli and debutant Sam Konstas had a physical encounter during the fourth Test at the MCG.

  • Kohli and Konstas collided on the field, sparking a moment of tension.
  • Konstas scored 60 runs off 65 balls on his debut before falling to Ravindra Jadeja.
  • Former players Ricky Ponting and Michael Vaughan commented on the incident, suggesting Kohli instigated it.
  • As of lunch, Australia was at 112-1, with Khawaja unbeaten on 38.
  • The series stands at 1-1 after a rainy draw in Brisbane.
  • Significant implications for the World Test Championship Final race were noted, with Australia and India vying for qualification.
“Virat’s walked one whole pitch over to his right and instigated that.” - Ricky Ponting

The ongoing rivalry and competitive spirit between these two cricketing nations continues to offer thrilling drama on the field.

item.title: 'Ashwin wouldn't have retired if he knew India at MCG…': Ravi Shastri's mic drop remark on Washington Sundar's return - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ashwin wouldn't have retired if he knew India at MCG…

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Ravi Shastri commented on Ravichandran Ashwin's retirement during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, suggesting that Ashwin might have continued playing if he had known that India would field two spinners at the MCG.

  • Ashwin retired after one Test in the series citing a lack of need in the Indian XI.
  • Shastri believes Ashwin would have stayed if aware of the spin-bowling strategy for the Boxing Day Test.
  • Washington Sundar was selected over Shubman Gill, surprising many experts.
  • The fourth Test is crucial, with both teams having won one match each.
“If Ashwin knew India would play two spinners, he might not have retired,” Ravi Shastri remarked.

This commentary sheds light on the strategic decisions surrounding team selection and how they impact player careers.

item.title: AUS 112-1 (28) | IND Vs AUS Live Cricket Score And Updates BGT 2024 4th Test: India Aim To Bounce Ba - Zee News
item.description:
India vs Australia, BGT 2024 4th Test Match Live Cricket Score and Updates

Last Updated: Dec 26, 2024, 11:52 AM IST | Source: Zee News

In the ongoing 4th Test match between India and Australia, Jasprit Bumrah made a key breakthrough by taking the wicket of Usman Khawaja during the second session of Day 2.

  • India's bowlers showed an improved performance despite only taking one wicket in the session.
  • Bumrah and Akash Deep troubled the Australian batsmen with tight bowling.
  • Khawaja reached fifty but was dismissed cheaply by Bumrah.
  • The pitch conditions have been challenging, with low carry making it difficult for slips to take catches.
  • Labuschagne is beginning to look more comfortable at the crease despite taking some hits.
“The pitch seems slow, suggesting the true nature might become clearer when Australia’s pacers bowl.”

The match continues, and India aims to capitalize on their breakthrough by seeking more wickets.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Usman Khawaja fifty drives Australia's charge after Lunch - India Today
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions

Date: Dec 26, 2024   |   Source: Cricket News

The 4th Test between India and Australia has begun at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with Australia dominating the early stages. Sam Konstas, a debutant, was impressive, however, Jasprit Bumrah made early attempts to claim wickets.

  • Australia scored 112 runs by lunch with the loss of 1 wicket.
  • Sam Konstas scored a rapid 60 before being dismissed by Ravindra Jadeja.
  • Bumrah struggled early, conceding runs but later found rhythm against Labuschagne.
  • Konstas' six against Bumrah was significant as it ended a three-year streak where no batsman hit Bumrah for six.
“It's quite surreal. Look at the turnout (of the crowd). I'm just trying to play with some freedom and back myself.” - Sam Konstas

As the match progresses, both teams are looking for early breakthroughs after lunch to set the pace for the remainder of the Test.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test: AUS 127/1 vs IND at Melbourne - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 4th Test: AUS 140/1 vs IND at Melbourne

Date: Thursday, December 28, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The opening day of the fourth Test between India and Australia sees Australia in a strong position at 140/1, with Sam Konstas making a solid debut performance.

  • Australia has made several changes to the playing XI, with debutant Sam Konstas and returning Scott Boland, while Shubman Gill misses out for India.
  • Sam Konstas scored a half-century, contributing to Australia’s strong start at 112/1 at lunch.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma confirmed he would be opening the innings for India.
  • The match is part of the 2024/25 India tour of Australia and will impact the Border-Gavaskar Trophy standings.
“Sam Konstas is set to make his debut for Australia, becoming the 468th player to receive the baggy green cap.”

The match is ongoing, and updates can be followed live for score and performance details.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 1, LIVE Score: Rohit Sharma's Plans Falter As Australia Tame India's Toothless Attack - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 1 LIVE Score Updates

Date & Source: December 26, 2024 | NDTV Sports

India's Jasprit Bumrah has taken Australia's second wicket, dismissing Usman Khawaja who scored 57 runs. Marnus Labuschagne is currently batting alongside Steve Smith, and Australia is seeking more partnerships to maintain their position.

  • Australia's Current Status: At Lunch, Australia's score was 112/1 with Khawaja (38) and Labuschagne (12) at the crease.
  • Key Performances: Sam Konstas scored 60 runs before being dismissed.
  • India's Team Changes: Rohit Sharma replaced Shubman Gill with Washington Sundar in a surprising move.
“Jasprit Bumrah has done it!!!! India’s biggest asset once again shows his true worth.”

Despite losing Khawaja, Labuschagne and Smith look to build a steady partnership on the second day.

item.title: Will Virat Kohli be sanctioned and suspended for Sydney Test by Andy Pycroft, the match referee for shoulder barging Sam Konstas? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Virat Kohli Faces Potential Sanction After On-Field Incident with Sam Konstas

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Indian Express

In a controversial moment during the match, Virat Kohli's shoulder barge with Sam Konstas has raised questions about possible sanctions by match referee Andy Pycroft, potentially affecting Kohli's eligibility for the upcoming Sydney Test.

  • Kohli cut across the pitch, leading to physical contact with Konstas.
  • The incident falls under cricket's Law 2.12 regarding inappropriate physical contact.
  • If deemed a Level Two offence by Pycroft, Kohli could face suspension due to demerit points.
  • Kohli has a history of similar incidents, having received a demerit point in a 2019 match.
  • Former cricketer Ricky Ponting criticized Kohli for instigating the confrontation.
“No doubt in my mind whatsoever. Fielders should be nowhere near the batsman at that stage.” — Ricky Ponting

This incident may lead to serious consequences for Kohli if taken further by match officials, potentially impacting his participation in future matches.

item.title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: All you need to know - ESPN India
item.description:
FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: All You Need to Know

Date: December 26, 2024
Source: ESPN

Hot on the heels of the FIDE World Championship that saw Dommaraju Gukesh crowned classical chess champion of the world comes FIDE's World Championship for the faster versions of the sport: rapid and blitz.

Key Points:

  • The championship will take place in Wall Street, New York, from December 26 to December 31.
  • Rapid Championships will follow a Swiss system, with players competing in multiple rounds.
  • The Blitz tournament will begin with a similar format but will culminate in a knockout stage for the top 8 players.
  • Time controls for Rapid are 15 minutes plus a 10-second increment, while Blitz games are 3 minutes with a 2-second increment.
  • Favorites include defending champion Magnus Carlsen and top-rated women players like Hou Yifan and Ju Wenjun.
  • Indian chess players such as Arjun Erigaisi and Koneru Humpy are expected to perform well.
  • The tournament will be livestreamed on the official FIDE YouTube channel.
“Many of the same names... but clearly it's Hikaru, Alireza and then everybody else.” - Magnus Carlsen

Conclusion:

The FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships promise to be an exciting event for chess enthusiasts, showcasing top talents and thrilling competition.

item.title: "A Disservice...": On Not Being Given A Farewell, Ravichandran Ashwin Has Final Say - NDTV Sports
item.description:
A Disservice...: On Not Being Given A Farewell, Ravichandran Ashwin Has Final Say

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Former India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has commented on his recent retirement from international cricket, stating that he doesn't believe in grand farewell ceremonies.

  • Ashwin's retirement announcement was abrupt, catching many by surprise.
  • Kapil Dev expressed that Ashwin deserved a respectful farewell.
  • Ashwin firmly opposes the idea of grand farewells, viewing them as part of a celebrity culture.
  • He emphasizes the importance of legacy over ceremonies, suggesting that farewells can be seen as a disservice to the game.
  • Despite his achievements, including 106 Tests and 537 wickets, Ashwin is content with his quiet departure.
  • He denied any familial issues following his sudden retirement.
“I think grand send-offs are part of a super celebrity culture.” - Ravichandran Ashwin

Ashwin's perspective reflects a humble approach to his career, focusing on the impact he leaves rather than fanfare.

item.title: Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli involved in physical altercation with Sam Konstas; Ponting, Vaughan want ICC match referee to take action

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses a physical confrontation between Virat Kohli and debutant Sam Konstas during the first day of the India vs Australia Test match in Melbourne. The incident drew criticism from former players Ricky Ponting and Michael Vaughan, who called for the ICC match referee to take action.

  • The altercation happened after the 10th over when Kohli and Konstas crossed paths on the field.
  • Former players Vaughan and Ponting remarked on Kohli's role in instigating the confrontation.
  • Despite the clash, Konstas continued to perform well, scoring a half-century on his debut.
  • Konstas is recognized as Australia's fourth youngest Test debutant.
“Virat has walked one whole pitch over to his right and instigated that confrontation.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the pressures of competitive cricket and the scrutiny players face from former professionals and fans alike.

item.title: Confronted By Ravi Shastri On Poor Form, Virat Kohli Says "These Pitches Are..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Confronted By Ravi Shastri On Poor Form, Virat Kohli Says "These Pitches Are..."

Publication Date: December 26, 2024   |   Source: NDTV

India's leading batsman Virat Kohli has reflected on his recent struggles with form in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, expressing the need for discipline and adaptation to the livelier Australian pitches.

  • Kohli admitted to inconsistent performances, with scores of 7, 11, and 3 following a century.
  • He emphasized the importance of adapting to the current portrayal of pitches in Australia.
  • Kohli spoke about managing expectations as a top player and focusing on game plans.
  • The series is currently level at 1-1, highlighting the competitive nature of the matches.
  • Kohli has historically performed well at the MCG, holding fond memories of past successes here.
“Expectations are always going to be there... but it’s important to follow the game plan.” — Virat Kohli

In conclusion, Kohli aims to re-establish his form and help lead India to victory in upcoming matches, focusing on situational awareness and capitalizing on opportunities.

item.title: Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Video: Virat Kohli's Act To Unsettle Sam Konstas Leads To Heated Clash On Field

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: NDTV

During the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, Australian debutant Sam Konstas fiercely batted against India, leading to a heated exchange with Virat Kohli. Despite attempts to unsettle him, Konstas maintained his form to score a half-century.

  • Sam Konstas scored a 52-ball half-century on his Test debut.
  • Virat Kohli attempted to disrupt Konstas with a shoulder push.
  • The altercation escalated, prompting intervention from players and umpires.
  • Konstas became the fourth youngest Test debutant for Australia, making his debut at age 19 years and 85 days.
“Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas exchanged a heated moment on the MCG.” — cricket.com.au

This match showcases the competitive spirit of cricket and the challenges faced by debutants in high-pressure situations.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Sam Konstas' audacious fifty puts Australia in command - India Today
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test, Day 1 Live Updates: Sam Konstas Dismissed by Jadeja

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Multiple

The 4th Test between India and Australia has started with exciting moments, including Sam Konstas's impressive debut and a critical wicket by Ravindra Jadeja that has swung the momentum.

  • Sam Konstas scored 60 runs before being dismissed by Jadeja.
  • The current batsmen are Marnus Labuschagne and Usman Khawaja.

“It's quite surreal. Look at the turnout (of the crowd). I'm just trying to play with some freedom and back myself.” - Sam Konstas

This match promises to be a thrilling contest as both teams step up their game on this significant stage.

item.title: IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill misses out, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS 4th Test: Shubman Gill dropped, Washington Sundar comes in; Australia opt to bat vs India

Publication Date: December 29, 2023

Source: Times of India

Australia won the toss and opted to bat first in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). India made a notable change by dropping Shubman Gill and including Washington Sundar in the lineup.

  • Rohit Sharma confirmed the team change, emphasizing the team's readiness to compete in a close series (1-1).
  • Pat Cummins expressed confidence in batting first, noting the good condition of the pitch with some grass.
  • The series remains competitive following India’s previous win and Australia’s victory in the second Test.
“We would have batted as well, looks like a good wicket. The series is 1-1, a lot to play for.” - Rohit Sharma

The Boxing Day Test is crucial for both teams as they aim for series victory following an exciting draw in the previous match.

Australia won the toss and opted to bat first in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). India made a notable change by dropping Shubman Gill and including Washington Sundar in the lineup.

item.title: Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli Get Out On Christmas Date After R Ashwin's Cryptic Comment About Their PDA - News18
item.description:
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli Enjoy Christmas Date Amid R Ashwin's Comments

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: News18

Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were spotted on a date on Christmas Day in Australia, taking a stroll in Melbourne.

  • The couple walked around Melbourne without their children.
  • Virat is in Australia for his cricket schedule, with a Boxing Day Test match upcoming.
  • R Ashwin made comments regarding the temperament differences between him and Virat in a recent podcast.
  • Anushka and Virat have not publicly responded to Ashwin's remarks.
“I wanted people to know me for who I am... Ashwin's picking up a wicket, and Virat Kohli is all over the place.” - R Ashwin

The couple's outing comes shortly after their wedding anniversary, which they celebrated privately.

item.title: "Disservice to the game": Ravichandran Ashwin makes a strong statement on not getting farewell after his retirement - Crictoday
item.description:
“Disservice to the game”: Ravichandran Ashwin makes a strong statement on not getting farewell after his retirement

Publication Date: September 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Ravichandran Ashwin revealed that he does not believe in grand farewells following his retirement from international cricket, which surprised many in the cricket community.

  • Ashwin announced his retirement after the third Test against Australia.
  • He responded to Kapil Dev's suggestion of a grand farewell, stating he does not want such recognition.
  • Ashwin's decision was sudden and caught even his close teammates off guard.
  • He emphasized that farewells are a disservice to the game.
  • Ashwin plans to remain connected with cricket and will play for Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2025.
“For me, farewells are wrong... I never wanted a grand farewell for myself.”

Ashwin expressed no regrets about his retirement and affirmed he values his achievements as a cricketer.

item.title: 'Second to none' Mohammad Abbas ready for his redemption arc - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Second to none: Mohammad Abbas ready for his redemption arc

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ESPNcricinfo

Mohammad Abbas, returning to the Pakistan Test team after a three-year absence, showcases his exceptional bowling skills and team spirit as he prepares for the upcoming series in South Africa. Despite the mystery surrounding his exclusion from the team, his consistent performances at Hampshire have earned him this much-deserved opportunity.

  • Abbas has taken 180 wickets at an average of 19.26 over the past three seasons with Hampshire.
  • He last played for Pakistan in August 2021, demonstrating his prowess with a ten-wicket haul against Australia.
  • Coaches and teammates believe his skillset is crucial for the team’s success in South Africa.
  • During his absence, other fast bowlers have emerged, but Abbas remains the most prolific bowler in first-class cricket since his last Test match.
  • His return is seen as a chance to correct past mistakes and showcase his talent on the international stage.

"His skill is second to none." - Shan Masood, Pakistan Test captain

The cricket community awaits Abbas’s performance as he returns to represent Pakistan, hopeful for a successful redemption.

item.title: Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup - PCB
item.description:
Yasir and Ali star as ABL Stallions trump UMT Markhors to win Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup

Date: 25 December 2024, Source: PCB

A swashbuckling hundred from opener Yasir Ali and a brilliant bowling display by Mohammad Ali led ABL Stallions to a 75-run victory over UMT Markhors in the Bahria Town Champions T20 Cup final held at Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

  • Yasir scored 100 runs off 57 balls, hitting seven sixes and five boundaries.
  • ABL Stallions set a target of 200 runs, finishing their innings at 199-5.
  • UMT Markhors were bowled out for 124 runs in 19.1 overs.
  • Mohammad Ali took 3 wickets for 19 runs, while Usman Tariq took 2 wickets for just 10 runs.
  • This victory marks another title for ABL Stallions in Pakistan’s T20 history.
Player of the Final - Yasir Khan (ABL Stallions)
Player of the Tournament - Mohammad Ali (ABL Stallions)

The ABL Stallions celebrate another championship win, dominating throughout the tournament.
